item.title:
RT by @a_leesha1: BT Group made ¬£1.3bn profit.
BT Group paid out ¬£700m to shareholders.
BT Group CEO paid ¬£3.5m this year.
BT Group have opened foodbanks at work because staff can‚Äôt get through the month on their own pay.
No more. No further. The line is drawn.
VOTE YES TODAY.

item.title: RT by @a_leesha1: Your 9-5 is because of unions. Your lunch break? Unions. Holiday pay? Unions. Sick pay? Unions. Health and safety requirements? Unions. Work condition requirements? Unions. Mat/Pat/adoption/foster leave? Unions. Any shred of workplace autonomy. Unions.
item.dc:creator: @CharMcew
item.description:
Your 9-5 is because of unions.
Your lunch break? Unions.
Holiday pay? Unions.
Sick pay? Unions.
Health and safety requirements? Unions.
Work condition requirements? Unions.
Mat/Pat/adoption/foster leave? Unions.
Any shred of workplace autonomy. Unions.

item.title: R to @a_leesha1: If pictures like that were taken of children in this country, they‚Äôd catch a case. Literally just shows how dehumanised children in war zones & LEDCs are.
item.dc:creator: @a_leesha1
item.description: If pictures like that were taken of children in this country, they‚Äôd catch a case. Literally just shows how dehumanised children in war zones & LEDCs are.

item.title:
I can‚Äôt stand journalists or so-called humanitarian workers who go to war zones & LEDCs to photograph children in their most vulnerable moments without consent from the children or parents.
You don‚Äôt post your own kids on the internet, so why do you post others‚Äô?

item.title:
RT by @a_leesha1: If you're wondering why doctors are considering strike action, I've worked full time for two years. My pay this month is ¬£1700.
I have a job where I am responsible for your life. You do not want me worrying about how I'm going to pay for my petrol when you're septic at 4am.

item.title: RT by @a_leesha1: Every time someone says ‚Äúwho‚Äôs idea was it to make the weekend only two days‚Äù I think of this. We wouldn‚Äôt even have *two* days had working class people and trade unions not organised and fought for us. It wasn‚Äôt inevitable. It was fought for. Support the strikes! Join a union!

item.title: RT by @a_leesha1: If this isn't the truth, you have to constantly get yourself to manage your own expectations on what you might and might not do in the future, or else you'll end up disappointing yourself. And it's so much worse when you come from a working class background.

item.title:
RT by @a_leesha1: I'm sick of white citizen commenters framing the very *real* ripping of human beings from their communities as 'distractions' from the issues they care about.
There's nothing metaphorical or 'distracting' about being dragged from your home and forcibly flown to another country
